title: Question 2
prompt:
The first two lines of the poem are similar in structure to the next two. What does this similarity of structure accomplish?
The similarity of structure
description: Click the <u>one best answer</u> to each question.
feedback:
The first stanza describes two different situations when the narrator is angry. The first two lines describe when the narrator was angry with a friend, and the second two lines describe when the narrator was angry with a foe, or enemy. The second and fourth lines describe the results of the two different situations. Anger toward a friend is discussed and forgotten, while anger toward an enemy is kept inside and grows. The repetition creates a comparison of the results of his anger in two situations.


I was angry with my friend.
I told my wrath, my wrath did end.
I was angry with my foe.
I told it not, my wrath did grow;
